sections.heading: Short title. This Act may be cited as the Employee Sick Leave Act.
sections.text: Short title. This Act may be cited as the Employee Sick Leave Act.

sections.heading: Rights and remedies.  The rights and remedies specified in this Act are in addition to any other rights or remedies afforded by contract or under other provisions of law
sections.text: This Act does not prevent an employer from providing greater sick leave benefits than are provided for under this Act. This Act

sections.text: Retaliation prohibited. An employer shall not deny an employee the right to use personal sick leave benefits in accordance with this Act or discharge, threaten to discharge, demote, suspend, or in any manner discriminate against an employee for using personal sick leave benefits, attempting to exercise the right to use personal sick leave benefits, filing a complaint with the Illinois Department of Labor or alleging a violation of this Act, cooperating in an investigation or prosecution of an alleged violation of this Act, or opposing any policy or practice or act that is prohibited by this Act. Nothing in this Section prohibits an employer from applying the terms and conditions set forth in the employment benefit plan or paid time off policy applicable to personal sick leave benefits.

sections.heading: Rules. The Department may adopt rules to implement this Act.
sections.text: Rules. The Department may adopt rules to implement this Act.

sections.heading: Effective date. This Act takes effect on January 1, 2017.
sections.text: Effective date. This Act takes effect on January 1, 2017.
